references: Ligon, J.S. 1961. New Mexico birds and where to find them. The University of New Mexico Press, Albuquerque.
Roth, S.D and J.M. Marzluff. 1989. Nest Placement and productivity of Ferruginous Hawks in western Kansas. Transactions Kansas Acad. Science 92:132-148.
Schmutz, J.K. 1987. The effect of agriculture on ferruginous and Swainson's hawks. Journal of Range Management, 40:438-440.
Plumpton, D. L. and D. E. Andersen. 1997. Habitat use and time budgeting by wintering Ferruginous Hawks. Condor 99:888–893.

Bak, J. M., K. G. Boykin, B. C. Thompson, D. L. Daniel. 2001. Distribution of wintering ferruginous hawks (Buteo regalis) in relation to black-tailed prairie dog (Cynomys ludovicianus) colonies in southern New Mexico and northern Chihuahua. Journal of Raptor Research. 35:124-130.
Keeley, W. H. and M. J. Bechard. 2011. Flushing Distances of Ferruginous Hawks Nesting in Rural and Exurban New Mexico. Journal of Wildlife Management. 75: 1034-1039
Carroll, S.K., T.C. Carter, and G.A. Feldhammer. 2002. Placement of nets for bats: effects on perceived fauna. Southeastern Naturalist, 1(2):193-198.
Schmutz, J. K. and R. W. Fyfe. 1987. Migration and mortality of Alberta Ferruginous Hawks. Condor 89:169–174.
Keough, H. L. 2006. Factors influencing breeding Ferruginous Hawks (Buteo regalis) in the Uintah Basin, Utah. Ph.D. Dissertation, Utah State University, Logan, UT.
Gilmer, D. S. and R. E. Stewart. 1983. Ferruginous Hawk populations and habitat use in North Dakota. J. Wildl. Manage. 47:146-157.
Cook, R. R., J.-L. E. Cartron, and P. Polechla Dr. 2003. The importance of prairie dogs to nesting ferruginous hawks in grassland ecosystems. Wildlife Society Bulletin. 31:1073-1082.
Leary, A. W., R. Mazaika, and M. J. Bechard. 1998. Factors affecting the size of Ferruginous Hawk home ranges. Wilson Bulletin 110:198-205.

Giovanni, M. D., C. W. Boal, and H. A. Whitlaw. 2007. Prey use and provisioning rates of breeding Ferruginous and Swainson’s Hawks of the southern Great Plains, USA. The Wilson Journal of OOrnithology 119:558-569.
Woffinden, N. D. 1975. Ecology of the Ferruginous Hawk (Buteo regalis) in central Utah: population dynamics and nest site selection. Master's Thesis. Brigham Young Univ. Provo, UT.
Ramakka, J. M. and R. T. Woyewodzic. 1993. Nesting ecology of Ferruginous Hawk in northwestern New Mexico. Journal of Raptor Research. 27:97-101.
Bechard M. J., R. L. Knight, D. G. Smith, and R. E. Fitzner. 1990. Nest site and habitat of sympatric hawks (Buteo spp.) in Washington. Journal of Field Ornithology. 61:159-170.
Howard, R. P. and M. L. Wolfe. 1976. Range improvement practices and Ferruginous Hawks. J. Range Manage. 29:33-37.
Jasikoff, T.M. 1982. Habitat suitability index models: ferrigunous hawk. U.S.D.I. Fish Wildl. Serv. FSW/OBS-82/10.10. 18 pp.
White, C. M. and T. L. Thurow. 1985. Reproduction of ferrignous hawks exposed to controlled disturbance. Condor. 87-14-22

Bechard, Marc J. and Josef K. Schmutz. 1995. Ferruginous Hawk (Buteo regalis), The Birds of North America Online (A. Poole, Ed.). Ithaca: Cornell Lab of Ornithology; Retrieved from the Birds of North America Online: http://ida.lib.uidaho.edu:2123/bna/species/172
Fitzner, R. E., D. Berry, L. L. Boyd, and C. A. Reick. 1977. Nesting of Ferruginous Hawks (Buteo regalis) in Washington, 1974-75. Condor 79:245-249.
Cully Jr., J. F. 1991. Response of raptors to reduction of a Gunnison’s prairie dog population by plague. American Midland Naturalist 125:140–149.

Allison, P. S., A. W. Leary, and M. J. Bechard. 1995. Observations of wintering Ferruginous Hawks (Buteo regalis) feeding on prairie dogs (Cynomys ludovicianus) in the Texas panhandle. Texas Journal of Science 47:235–236.
Konrad, P. M. and D. S. Gilmer. 1986. Post fledging behavior of Ferruginous Hawks in North Dakota. Raptor Res. 20:35-39.
Olendorff, R. R. 1993. Status, biology, and management of Ferruginous Hawks: a review. Raptor Res. and Tech. Asst. Cen., Spec. Rep. U.S. Dep. Interior, Bur. Land Manage. Boise, ID.

Eakle, W.L., E.L. Smith, S.W. Hoffman, D.W. Stahlecker, and R.B. Duncan. 1996. Results of a raptor
survey in southwestern New Mexico. Journal of Raptor Research 30(4):183-188.

Atkinson, E. C. 1992. Ferruginous hawk (BUTEO REGALIS) inventories on the Dillon Resource Area of southwest Montana: 1992. Montana Natural Heritage Program for Bureau of Land Management, Dillon Resource Area. 34 pp.
habitat_description: B. reglis inhabits: grasslands, semi-desert shrub-steppe, sagebrush rangelands, salt brush-greasewood shrublands, savannas, pasture/hay fields, riparian woodlands, and the periphery of pinyon-juniper and other woodlands (Woffinden, 1975; Fitzner et al., 1977; Jasikoff, 1982; Gilmer and Stewart, 1983; Konrad and Gilmer, 1986; Atkinson, 1992; Olendorf, 1993; Bechard and Schmutz, 1995; Leary et al., 1998; Keough, 2006). Croplands are used for foraging, but not extensive swaths of uninterrupted, tilled cropland (Schmutz, 1987; Olendorf, 1993). The species avoids forest interior, high elevations, and narrow canyons (Bechard and Schmutz, 1995).
